pageContext.claim: “That's why we are allowing local police to access surplus military equipment. And we've been doing this since the very first day of my administration, whereas others didn't want you to have that equipment for very strange reasons.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The Obama administration scaled back the federal government's program of providing surplus military gear such as tanks and weapons to local police departments, a response to the images of militarized police during the unrest in Ferguson, Mo., in 2014. But Obama's restrictions clearly laid out a category of "controlled equipment" such as specialized firearms, manned and unmanned aircraft, explosives and riot gear that could still be provided upon demonstrated need.
